input.title: Here are two distinct, falsifiable hypotheses about HPC workflow provenance. Each is stated formally, followed by a brief description and the rationale behind it.

1. Hypothesis: “Automated, fine-grained provenance capture during HPC workflow execution reduces the average time to reproduce and debug a failed run by at least 30% compared to manual or coarse-grained provenance collection.”

2. Hypothesis: “A provenance‐graph compression algorithm that merges semantically equivalent workflow steps can reduce storage overhead by ≥70% while enabling result-reproduction accuracy within 5% of the original uncompressed provenance.”
